title: Rolling over faster than the French
author: VD
content_html:
From the Morocco Times:

France Interior Minister, Nicolas Sarkozy, said that “13,000 undocumented immigrants have been expelled in eight months,” and he is now committed to sending 10,000 more illegal foreigners home before the end of 2005, reported the Moroccan daily Assabah on Tuesday. He urged the police authorities to work hard to meet this goal….

Sarkozy has refused all the attempts made by different humanitarian associations and communities, explaining that “the European Court of Human Rights does not allow people to live wherever they like,” added the Moroccan daily. “Some countries refuse to cooperate with France in this respect, namely Belarusia, Cameroon, Egypt, Georgia, Guinea, Pakistan, Serbia and Sudan,” stated the same source.

“France, in return, will limit the quotas of visas given to citizens coming from these countries and wishing to go to France,” warned Sarkozy.

Interesting, is it not, that those feckless Europeans, so unwilling to go to war halfway across the world, are nevertheless able to identify their internal problem and deal with it. Of course, as I wrote before, the Europeans have never made it a habit to deal kindly with out-of-favor minorities once they are deemed overly troublesome.
content_text:
From
the Morocco Times
:
France Interior Minister, Nicolas Sarkozy, said that “13,000 undocumented immigrants have been expelled in eight months,” and he is now committed to sending 10,000 more illegal foreigners home before the end of 2005, reported the Moroccan daily Assabah on Tuesday.  He urged the police authorities to work hard to meet this goal….
Sarkozy has refused all the attempts made by different humanitarian associations and communities, explaining that “the European Court of Human Rights does not allow people to live wherever they like,” added the Moroccan daily.  “Some countries refuse to cooperate with France in this respect, namely Belarusia, Cameroon, Egypt, Georgia, Guinea, Pakistan, Serbia and Sudan,” stated the same source.
“France, in return, will limit the quotas of visas given to citizens coming from these countries and wishing to go to France,” warned Sarkozy.
Interesting, is it not, that those feckless Europeans, so unwilling to go to war halfway across the world, are nevertheless able to identify their internal problem and deal with it.  Of course, as I wrote before, the Europeans have never made it a habit to deal kindly with out-of-favor minorities once they are deemed overly troublesome.
